holidays.name: International Sunglasses Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating and promoting the importance of wearing sunglasses to protect your eyes from UV rays while looking cool!
holidays.origin: Created by the Vision Council to raise awareness about eye health and encourage the wearing of sunglasses.
holidays.funFact: The sunglasses trend began in the 1920s when movie stars started wearing tinted glasses to shield their eyes from bright studio lights!

holidays.name: Chocolate Pudding Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the creamy, smooth, and utterly delicious chocolate pudding on this decadent dessert day!
holidays.origin: An informal food holiday adopted by dessert lovers and pudding manufacturers to honor this beloved treat.
holidays.funFact: Chocolate pudding was originally made with cornstarch as a thickener and became widely popular in the U.S. in the early 1900s.

holidays.name: World Drifting Day
holidays.description: A celebration for car enthusiasts who love the art of drifting — sliding a car through turns while maintaining control and style!
holidays.origin: Started by motorsport fans and drivers to appreciate the skill and thrills of drifting, which originated in Japan.
holidays.funFact: The Japanese race driver Kunimitsu Takahashi is often credited as the 'father of drifting,' bringing it to the forefront in the 1970s.

holidays.name: Admire Your Navel Day
holidays.description: A quirky and humorous holiday encouraging people to take a moment to look at and appreciate their belly buttons — the little navel that once connected us to our mothers.
holidays.origin: An unofficial mystifying day created online to celebrate body positivity and the weird little things about our bodies.
holidays.funFact: No two belly buttons are alike — they can be innies, outies, or varying shapes, making each one unique!
